metadata.title: CVE-2020-14002 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
PuTTY 0.68 through 0.73 has an Observable Discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation. This allows man-in-the-middle attackers to target initial connection attempts (where no host key for the server has been cached by the client).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-14002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pterm - 0.74-1
putty - 0.74-1
putty-tools - 0.74-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: putty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.74-1').
